intro: Astragalus hamosus var. microcarpus, commonly known as the small-fruited milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems with alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, followed by narrow, legume-like pods containing small, smooth seeds. It is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. This species is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soils and supporting pollinators.
